Detailed Description

AIState Used to track and trigger AI state changes.

Member Function Documentation

void AIState::SetState ( u32  State  )  [inline]

Sets the current state. This will reset duration and set the previous state. If the previous state that State are different, this counts as "Triggering" a state change.

Parameters:
State The desired state.

Bool AIState::Triggered ( void   )  [inline]

Returns True if the state has changed since Tiggered was last changed.

Returns:
Bool - Recent state change

void AIState::InitState ( i32  State  )  [inline]

Sets the state. This will overwrite current and previous the state. This does not counts as "Triggering" a state change.

Parameters:
State The desired state.

i32 AIState::GetState ( void   )  [inline]

Returns the current state.

Returns:
i32

i32 AIState::GetPreviousState ( void   )  [inline]

Returns the previous state.

Returns:
i32 - previous state

i32 AIState::GetFlags ( void   )  [inline]

Returns internal flags. You should not have to use this function.

Returns:
i32 - internal flags

f32 AIState::GetTime ( void   )  [inline]

Returns the duration of the current state.

Returns:
f32 - time in seconds

void AIState::UpdateTime ( f32  DeltaTime  )  [inline]

Updates the internal timer.

Parameters:
DeltaTime Time since UpdateTime was last called (in seconds).
